verses.esv:
16   There are six things that the LORD hates,
    seven that are an abomination to him:
17   haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
    and hands that shed innocent blood,
18   a heart that devises wicked plans,
    feet that make haste to run to evil,
19   a false witness who breathes out lies,
    and one who sows discord among brothers.
verses.kjv: 16 These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him: 17 A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood, 18 An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief, 19 A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
verses.niv: 16 There are six things the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to him: 17 haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood, 18 a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are quick to rush into evil, 19 a false witness who pours out lies and a man who stirs up dissension among brothers.

verses.esv:
22   Lying lips are an abomination to the LORD,
    but those who act faithfully are his delight.
verses.kjv: 22 Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
verses.niv: 22 The LORD detests lying lips, but he delights in men who are truthful.

verses.esv:
9   A false witness will not go unpunished,
    and he who breathes out lies will perish.
verses.kjv: 9 A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
verses.niv: 9 A false witness will not go unpunished, and he who pours out lies will perish.

verses.esv:
7   No one who practices deceit
    shall dwell in my house;
  no one who utters lies
    shall continue before my eyes.
verses.kjv: 7 He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.
verses.niv: 7 No one who practices deceit will dwell in my house; no one who speaks falsely will stand in my presence.

verses.esv:
19   Truthful lips endure forever,
    but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
verses.kjv: 19 The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
verses.niv: 19 Truthful lips endure forever, but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.

verses.esv: 9 Do not lie to one another, seeing that you have put off the old self with its practices 10 and have put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge after the image of its creator.
verses.kjv: 9 Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds; 10 And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:
verses.niv: 9 Do not lie to each other, since you have taken off your old self with its practices 10 and have put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge in the image of its Creator.

verses.esv: 17 For nothing is hidden that will not be made manifest, nor is anything secret that will not be known and come to light.
verses.kjv: 17 For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither any thing hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.
verses.niv: 17 For there is nothing hidden that will not be disclosed, and nothing concealed that will not be known or brought out into the open.

verses.esv: 44 You are of your father the devil, and your will is to do your father’s desires. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks out of his own character, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.kjv: 44 Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.
verses.niv: 44 You belong to your father, the devil, and you want to carry out your father's desire. He was a murderer from the beginning, not holding to the truth, for there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks his native language, for he is a liar and the father of lies.

verses.esv: 16 “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.kjv: 16 Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.
verses.niv: 16 "You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.

verses.esv: 25 Therefore, having put away falsehood, let each one of you speak the truth with his neighbor, for we are members one of another.
verses.kjv: 25 Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.
verses.niv: 25 Therefore each of you must put off falsehood and speak truthfully to his neighbor, for we are all members of one body.

verses.esv: 4 Whoever says “I know him” but does not keep his commandments is a liar, and the truth is not in him,
verses.kjv: 4 He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.
verses.niv: 4 The man who says, "I know him," but does not do what he commands is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

verses.esv: 8 But as for the cowardly, the faithless, the detestable, as for murderers, the sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars, their portion will be in the lake that burns with fire and sulfur, which is the second death.”
verses.kjv: 8 But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone: which is the second death.
verses.niv: 8 But the cowardly, the unbelieving, the vile, the murderers, the sexually immoral, those who practice magic arts, the idolaters and all liars--their place will be in the fiery lake of burning sulfur. This is the second death."

verses.esv:
5   A false witness will not go unpunished,
    and he who breathes out lies will not escape.
verses.kjv: 5 A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
verses.niv: 5 A false witness will not go unpunished, and he who pours out lies will not go free.

verses.esv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.kjv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verses.niv: 9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.

verses.esv: 11 “You shall not steal; you shall not deal falsely; you shall not lie to one another.
verses.kjv: 11 Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.
verses.niv: 11 "'Do not steal. "'Do not lie. "'Do not deceive one another.

verses.esv:
28   Be not a witness against your neighbor without cause,
    and do not deceive with your lips.
verses.kjv: 28 Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.
verses.niv: 28 Do not testify against your neighbor without cause, or use your lips to deceive.

verses.esv:
6   The getting of treasures by a lying tongue
    is a fleeting vapor and a snare of death.
verses.kjv: 6 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
verses.niv: 6 A fortune made by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor and a deadly snare.

verses.esv:
5   A faithful witness does not lie,
    but a false witness breathes out lies.
verses.kjv: 5 A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
verses.niv: 5 A truthful witness does not deceive, but a false witness pours out lies.

verses.esv: 18 But what comes out of the mouth proceeds from the heart, and this defiles a person. 19 For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, slander. 20 These are what defile a person. But to eat with unwashed hands does not defile anyone.”
verses.kjv: 18 But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man. 19 For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies: 20 These are the things which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.
verses.niv: 18 But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart, and these make a man 'unclean.' 19 For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false testimony, slander. 20 These are what make a man 'unclean'; but eating with unwashed hands does not make him 'unclean.'"

verses.esv:
3   The wicked are estranged from the womb;
    they go astray from birth, speaking lies.
verses.kjv: 3 The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.
verses.niv: 3 Even from birth the wicked go astray; from the womb they are wayward and speak lies.

verses.esv: 14 But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast and be false to the truth.
verses.kjv: 14 But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.
verses.niv: 14 But if you harbor bitter envy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast about it or deny the truth.

verses.esv: 32 and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
verses.kjv: 32 And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
verses.niv: 32 Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free."

verses.esv: 9 Do not lie to one another, seeing that you have put off the old self with its practices
verses.kjv: 9 Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;
verses.niv: 9 Do not lie to each other, since you have taken off your old self with its practices

verses.esv:
18   Like a madman who throws firebrands, arrows, and death
19   is the man who deceives his neighbor
    and says, “I am only joking!”
verses.kjv: 18 As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death, 19 So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
verses.niv: 18 Like a madman shooting firebrands or deadly arrows 19 is a man who deceives his neighbor and says, "I was only joking!"

verses.esv:
5   The righteous hates falsehood,
    but the wicked brings shame and disgrace.
verses.kjv: 5 A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
verses.niv: 5 The righteous hate what is false, but the wicked bring shame and disgrace.
